description: Creates a prompt router that manages the routing of requests between multiple foundation models based on the routing criteria.

parameters.name: clientRequestToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure idempotency of your requests. If not specified, the Amazon Web Services SDK automatically generates one for you. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: promptRouterName
parameters.description: The name of the prompt router. The name must be unique within your Amazon Web Services account in the current region.

parameters.name: models
parameters.description: A list of foundation models that the prompt router can route requests to. At least one model must be specified. (dict) --- The target model for a prompt router. The target model's ARN.

parameters.name: routingCriteria
parameters.description: The criteria, which is the response quality difference, used to determine how incoming requests are routed to different models. The criteria's response quality difference.

parameters.name: fallbackModel
parameters.description: The default model to use when the routing criteria is not met. The target model's ARN.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource as tags. You can use tags to categorize and manage your Amazon Web Services resources. (dict) --- Definition of the key/value pair for a tag. Key for the tag. Value for the tag.

nested_items.name: promptRouterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the prompt router.
